entry.title: Talk:Skills
entry.summary:
A note on gemologist: typo

‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 21:36, 7 June 2024
(One intermediate revision by the same user not shown)
Line 28: Line 28:
¬†
:It seems I tested the sell prices of every item in-game (in every quality) ''except'' minerals for v1.5. I still have 1GB of screenshots saved on my hard drive from testing. All I can say is thank goodness minerals don't come in quality stars anymore! üò¨ [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 17:55, 9 July 2023 (UTC)
¬†
:It seems I tested the sell prices of every item in-game (in every quality) ''except'' minerals for v1.5. I still have 1GB of screenshots saved on my hard drive from testing. All I can say is thank goodness minerals don't come in quality stars anymore! üò¨ [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 17:55, 9 July 2023 (UTC)
¬†
:p.s. If there is a change in sell price that moves a mineral into a different level for the [[Stardew Valley Fair#Sell Price & Quality]], then we'll (meaning probably I'll) have to remember to update that as well. FYI. [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 19:56, 9 July 2023 (UTC)
¬†
:p.s. If there is a change in sell price that moves a mineral into a different level for the [[Stardew Valley Fair#Sell Price & Quality]], then we'll (meaning probably I'll) have to remember to update that as well. FYI. [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 19:56, 9 July 2023 (UTC)
¬†+
::It should take a set of at least 10 items to apply the increase to in order for the floored percentage to make a difference. I scarcely think that's likely. 30% of any integer smaller than 10 has a non-zero residual fraction which will decrease slightly at +29.999995%, but will easily cover the floor operation. [[User:Giles|Giles]] ([[User talk:Giles|talk]]) 21:35, 7 June 2024 (UTC)
¬†¬†
¬†
== Skill-Based Title ==
¬†
== Skill-Based Title ==

entry.title: Talk:Skills
entry.summary:
Skill-Based Title

‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 21:19, 7 June 2024
Line 39: Line 39:
¬†
:I did take a look at the code when you commented originally, but couldn't '''see''' why anything would change. Too much going on in my mind.
¬†
:I did take a look at the code when you commented originally, but couldn't '''see''' why anything would change. Too much going on in my mind.
¬†
:The code seems to have changed from an <samp>if</samp> statement to a <samp>switch case</samp>, and that changed the levels a bit. Thanks so much for looking out!! [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 19:59, 7 June 2024 (UTC)
¬†
:The code seems to have changed from an <samp>if</samp> statement to a <samp>switch case</samp>, and that changed the levels a bit. Thanks so much for looking out!! [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 19:59, 7 June 2024 (UTC)
¬†+
::You're welcome! I do seem to look at things that escape common notice, which makes me a positive nit-picker, I guess! But I'm also very aware of how little changes in code can affect things in subtle ways, and can cause real headaches in debugging. I would think any engineer would rather discover the hidden things than not to. One never knows what one little thing will lead to another, perhaps more important effect. [[User:Giles|Giles]] ([[User talk:Giles|talk]]) 21:18, 7 June 2024 (UTC)

entry.title: Talk:Books
entry.summary:
Unlocking the Reading of Books?

‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 21:09, 7 June 2024
Line 69: Line 69:
¬†
Is there a requirement that must be met before a player can read a book? I got one digging an artifact spot early in the game, but cannot read it. (Or is that a bug?) [[User:Giles|Giles]] ([[User talk:Giles|talk]]) 03:32, 7 June 2024 (UTC)
¬†
Is there a requirement that must be met before a player can read a book? I got one digging an artifact spot early in the game, but cannot read it. (Or is that a bug?) [[User:Giles|Giles]] ([[User talk:Giles|talk]]) 03:32, 7 June 2024 (UTC)
¬†
:I've added a paragraph to the page explaining how to read a book, similar to [[Secret Notes]]. Unlike Lost Books, they have to be actively read by the player. I hope this is the source of the issue for you, Giles! [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 19:48, 7 June 2024 (UTC)
¬†
:I've added a paragraph to the page explaining how to read a book, similar to [[Secret Notes]]. Unlike Lost Books, they have to be actively read by the player. I hope this is the source of the issue for you, Giles! [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 19:48, 7 June 2024 (UTC)
¬†+
::Many thanks! I have read books before, and thought I had done the process correctly again, but apparently I got some detail wrong, because it worked this time. Or perhaps there was some game load glitch that prevented it the first time, and a reload has fixed it up. Seems unlikely. [[User:Giles|Giles]] ([[User talk:Giles|talk]]) 21:08, 7 June 2024 (UTC)

entry.title: Stardrop Tea
entry.summary:
Use bundle template.

‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 20:44, 7 June 2024
Line 7: Line 7:
¬†
|edibility = -300
¬†
|edibility = -300
¬†
}}
¬†
}}
‚àí
'''Stardrop Tea''' is an item that can be obtained from the Prize Machine in the [[Mayor's Manor]] or randomly found in [[Fishing#Golden Treasure Chests|Golden Fishing Treasure Chests]] (7% chance).<ref name="chestchance" /> It is also a possible reward for quests beyond the 5th one from the [[Giant Stump|Raccoon]]. One Stardrop Tea is the reward for completing the [[Remixed Bundles#Bulletin Board|Helper's Bundle]].
+
'''Stardrop Tea''' is an item that can be obtained from the Prize Machine in the [[Mayor's Manor]] or randomly found in [[Fishing#Golden Treasure Chests|Golden Fishing Treasure Chests]] (7% chance).<ref name="chestchance" /> It is also a possible reward for quests beyond the 5th one from the [[Giant Stump|Raccoon]]. One Stardrop Tea is the reward for completing the {{Bundle|helpers|24|y}}.
¬†¬†
¬†
Stardrop Tea can be [[Friendship#Gifts|gifted]] for 250 friendship points (1 heart). If given as a birthday gift or during the [[Feast of the Winter Star]], it is worth 750 friendship points (3 hearts). Stardrop Tea does not count towards the daily or weekly gift limits, and can be freely gifted even if the limits have been reached. Players can also give multiple Stardrop Teas to the same person on a single day.<ref name="gift" /> ¬†
¬†
Stardrop Tea can be [[Friendship#Gifts|gifted]] for 250 friendship points (1 heart). If given as a birthday gift or during the [[Feast of the Winter Star]], it is worth 750 friendship points (3 hearts). Stardrop Tea does not count towards the daily or weekly gift limits, and can be freely gifted even if the limits have been reached. Players can also give multiple Stardrop Teas to the same person on a single day.<ref name="gift" /> ¬†

entry.title: Dressed Spinner
entry.summary:
Add location to bundle template.

‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 20:41, 7 June 2024
Line 9: Line 9:
¬†
The '''Dressed Spinner''' is a [[tackle]] that helps [[fishing]] by reducing maximum delay before a nibble by 7.5 seconds (15 seconds if the player is using an [[Advanced Iridium Rod]] with 2 Dressed Spinners). It can be [[Crafting#Fishing|crafted]] or purchased from [[Fish Shop|Willy's Fish Shop]] for {{Price|1000}} after reaching [[Fishing#Fishing Skill|Fishing level 8]]. It can also be found in regular [[Fishing#Treasure Chests|Fishing Treasure Chests]] (4% chance) after reaching Fishing level 6 and [[Fishing#Golden Treasure Chests|Golden Fishing Treasure Chests]] (9% chance).<ref name="chestchance" /> It may also randomly appear at the [[Traveling Cart]] for {{tprice|500}} or obtained as a gift from [[Willy]] at the [[Feast of the Winter Star]]. ¬†
¬†
The '''Dressed Spinner''' is a [[tackle]] that helps [[fishing]] by reducing maximum delay before a nibble by 7.5 seconds (15 seconds if the player is using an [[Advanced Iridium Rod]] with 2 Dressed Spinners). It can be [[Crafting#Fishing|crafted]] or purchased from [[Fish Shop|Willy's Fish Shop]] for {{Price|1000}} after reaching [[Fishing#Fishing Skill|Fishing level 8]]. It can also be found in regular [[Fishing#Treasure Chests|Fishing Treasure Chests]] (4% chance) after reaching Fishing level 6 and [[Fishing#Golden Treasure Chests|Golden Fishing Treasure Chests]] (9% chance).<ref name="chestchance" /> It may also randomly appear at the [[Traveling Cart]] for {{tprice|500}} or obtained as a gift from [[Willy]] at the [[Feast of the Winter Star]]. ¬†
¬†¬†
‚àí
One Dressed Spinner is the reward for completing the {{Bundle|Lake Fish}}. One Dressed Spinner is also one of the rewards the player gets the first time they win the fishing competition at the [[Festival of Ice]].
+
One Dressed Spinner is the reward for completing the {{Bundle|Lake Fish|24|y}}. One Dressed Spinner is also one of the rewards the player gets the first time they win the fishing competition at the [[Festival of Ice]].
¬†
{{#lst:Tackle|tackleuse}}
¬†
{{#lst:Tackle|tackleuse}}

entry.title: Heavy Furnace
entry.summary:
Clarify calculation only applies when smelting bars

‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 20:40, 7 June 2024
Line 14: Line 14:
¬†
To smelt any ore, equip it and activate the furnace while there is Coal in inventory. Three units of Coal are required for each smelting operation, regardless of the material or duration. Each possible output stack size is equally likely, ''i.e.'' ores have a 50% chance of yielding 5 bars and a 50% chance of yielding 6 bars.<ref name="extraBars" />
¬†
To smelt any ore, equip it and activate the furnace while there is Coal in inventory. Three units of Coal are required for each smelting operation, regardless of the material or duration. Each possible output stack size is equally likely, ''i.e.'' ores have a 50% chance of yielding 5 bars and a 50% chance of yielding 6 bars.<ref name="extraBars" />
¬†¬†
‚àí
In comparison to normal [[Furnace]]s, on average, 9% of the ore and 45% of the [[Coal]] is saved.
+
When smelting bars, on average, 9% of the ore and 45% of the [[Coal]] is saved in comparison to normal [[Furnace]]s.
¬†¬†
¬†
{|class="wikitable sortable"
¬†
{|class="wikitable sortable"
Line 74: Line 74:

¬†
==References==
¬†
<references>
¬†
<references>
‚àí
¬†¬† ¬† <ref name="extraBars">See <samp>Data/Machines.xnb</samp> in the game files. The output size is chosen using <samp>MinStack</samp> and <samp>MaxStack</samp>, which are not affected by any modifiers.</ref>
+

'''Complete Breakfast''' is a [[Cooking|cooked dish]]. It is prepared using either the kitchen inside an upgraded [[farmhouse]] or a [[Cookout Kit]].

Complete Breakfast may randomly appear in [[Krobus]]' shop on [[Days of the Week#Saturday|Saturdays]] or in [[the Stardrop Saloon]]'s rotating stock. The [[Statue Of Endless Fortune]] produces one Complete Breakfast per year on [[Alex]]'s birthday, [[Summer|Summer 13]]. ¬†
+
Complete Breakfast may randomly appear in [[Krobus]]' shop on [[Days of the Week#Saturday|Saturdays]] or in [[the Stardrop Saloon]]'s rotating stock. The [[Statue Of Endless Fortune]] produces one Complete Breakfast per year on [[Alex]]'s birthday, [[Summer|Summer 13]]. Five Complete Breakfasts are the reward for completing the {{Bundle|home cook|24|y}}.
¬†¬†
¬†
In total ingredients, cooking a Complete Breakfast from scratch requires 2 [[Egg]]s, 1 [[Oil]], 1 [[Wheat Flour]], 1 [[Potato]], and 1 [[Milk]]

entry.title: Heavy Furnace
entry.summary:
See calculations on talk page

‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 20:39, 7 June 2024
Line 14: Line 14:
¬†
To smelt any ore, equip it and activate the furnace while there is Coal in inventory. Three units of Coal are required for each smelting operation, regardless of the material or duration. Each possible output stack size is equally likely, ''i.e.'' ores have a 50% chance of yielding 5 bars and a 50% chance of yielding 6 bars.<ref name="extraBars" />
¬†
To smelt any ore, equip it and activate the furnace while there is Coal in inventory. Three units of Coal are required for each smelting operation, regardless of the material or duration. Each possible output stack size is equally likely, ''i.e.'' ores have a 50% chance of yielding 5 bars and a 50% chance of yielding 6 bars.<ref name="extraBars" />
¬†¬†
‚àí
When 5 bars are produced, the Heavy Furnace saves 40% [[Coal]] in comparison to normal [[Furnace]]s. When 6 bars are produced, 50% of the [[Coal]] and one sixth of the ore is saved in comparison to normal [[Furnace]]s.
+
In comparison to normal [[Furnace]]s, on average, 9% of the ore and 45% of the [[Coal]] is saved.
¬†¬†
¬†
{|class="wikitable sortable"
¬†
{|class="wikitable sortable"

entry.title: Talk:Heavy Furnace
entry.summary:
‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 20:38, 7 June 2024
Line 3: Line 3:
¬†¬†
¬†
I'm not sure, but according to the code, the probability of the Fire Quartz yielding 15,16,17,18,19,20 refined quartz should be 1/6 each, and the expectation per 5 fire quartz will be 17.5 refined quartz. Since the textual explanation seems a bit confusing, maybe we could emphasize the fire quartz as another example on the page. [[User:Áæ§Êòü‰πãÂ∞ò|Áæ§Êòü‰πãÂ∞ò]] ([[User talk:Áæ§Êòü‰πãÂ∞ò|talk]]) 18:34, 14 May 2024 (UTC)
¬†
I'm not sure, but according to the code, the probability of the Fire Quartz yielding 15,16,17,18,19,20 refined quartz should be 1/6 each, and the expectation per 5 fire quartz will be 17.5 refined quartz. Since the textual explanation seems a bit confusing, maybe we could emphasize the fire quartz as another example on the page. [[User:Áæ§Êòü‰πãÂ∞ò|Áæ§Êòü‰πãÂ∞ò]] ([[User talk:Áæ§Êòü‰πãÂ∞ò|talk]]) 18:34, 14 May 2024 (UTC)
¬†+
¬†+
==Calculations==
¬†+
The current calculations are not very insightful as they consider each case individually. It would be more efficient to combine the cases considering we know the chances of each case happening:
¬†+
¬†+
On average, every two times the player uses the Heavy Furnace, exactly 11 bars will be produced, using 50 Ore and 6 Coal. With a regular Furnace, we would need to use 55 Ore and 11 Coal to make 11 Bars. Therefore, on average, 45% of the Coal is saved and 9% of the Ore is saved. [[User:User314159|User314159]] ([[User talk:User314159|talk]]) 20:38, 7 June 2024 (UTC)

entry.title: Tapper
entry.summary:
Reward from Forager's Bundle, assuming in 1.5.

‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 20:37, 7 June 2024
Line 10: Line 10:
¬†
The '''Tapper''' is a type of [[Crafting#Refining Equipment|Refining Equipment]] that can be placed on a [[Trees|tree]] to produce [[Maple Syrup]], [[Oak Resin]], [[Pine Tar]], [[Sap]], or [[Mystic Syrup]]. It can also be placed on a [[Mushroom Tree]] to produce different mushrooms. It can also be placed on a [[Green Rain Trees|Fern Green Rain Tree]] to produce [[Fiddlehead Fern]]s. Other types of Green Rain Tree cannot be tapped.
¬†
The '''Tapper''' is a type of [[Crafting#Refining Equipment|Refining Equipment]] that can be placed on a [[Trees|tree]] to produce [[Maple Syrup]], [[Oak Resin]], [[Pine Tar]], [[Sap]], or [[Mystic Syrup]]. It can also be placed on a [[Mushroom Tree]] to produce different mushrooms. It can also be placed on a [[Green Rain Trees|Fern Green Rain Tree]] to produce [[Fiddlehead Fern]]s. Other types of Green Rain Tree cannot be tapped.
¬†¬†
‚àí
When a tree has a Tapper on it, the tree is unable to be directly shaken (by interacting with it). However, if the tree is moss-covered, it will be shaken when you swing a scythe or weapon on the tree to remove the moss.
+
When a tree has a Tapper on it, the tree is unable to be directly shaken (by interacting with it). However, if the tree is moss-covered, it will be shaken when the player swings a scythe or weapon on the tree to remove the moss.
¬†¬†
¬†
The Tapper can be removed from a tree by hitting it once with an [[Axes|axe]] or [[Pickaxes|pickaxe]]. This leaves the Tapper intact and able to be reused. If the Tapper is on a tree when it is struck by [[Weather#Storm|lightning]] or hit by an exploding [[Crafting#Bombs|bomb]], both the Tapper and its contents are destroyed.
¬†
The Tapper can be removed from a tree by hitting it once with an [[Axes|axe]] or [[Pickaxes|pickaxe]]. This leaves the Tapper intact and able to be reused. If the Tapper is on a tree when it is struck by [[Weather#Storm|lightning]] or hit by an exploding [[Crafting#Bombs|bomb]], both the Tapper and its contents are destroyed.
Line 17: Line 17:
¬†¬†
¬†
The Tapper cannot be placed on [[Fruit Trees]].
¬†
The Tapper cannot be placed on [[Fruit Trees]].
¬†+
¬†+
Three Tappers are the reward for completing the {{Bundle|foragers|24|y}}.
¬†¬†
¬†
==Products==
¬†
==Products==
Line 130: Line 132:
¬†
==History==
¬†
==History==
¬†
{{History|1.4|Fixed issue that could leave trees unchoppable if tapper was removed in unusual fashion. Tappers can now be stacked in a player's [[inventory]] and in [[chest]]s.}}
¬†
{{History|1.4|Fixed issue that could leave trees unchoppable if tapper was removed in unusual fashion. Tappers can now be stacked in a player's [[inventory]] and in [[chest]]s.}}
‚àí
{{History|1.5|Added the [[Heavy Tapper]]. Fixed bug where processing time was affected by the time of day.}}
+
{{History|1.5|Added the [[Heavy Tapper]]. Fixed bug where processing time was affected by the time of day. Can now be obtained from the Forager's Bundle.}}
¬†
{{History|1.6|Recipe is now learned at [[Skills#Foraging|Foraging]] Level 4 instead of Level 3. [[Mystic Syrup]] and [[Fiddlehead Fern]] now possible products.}}
¬†
{{History|1.6|Recipe is now learned at [[Skills#Foraging|Foraging]] Level 4 instead of Level 3. [[Mystic Syrup]] and [[Fiddlehead Fern]] now possible products.}}
¬†¬†

entry.title: Furnace
entry.summary:
Reward from completing Engineer's Bundle (as of 1.5, I believe).

‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 20:32, 7 June 2024
Line 15: Line 15:
¬†
If you have not yet met Clint when he comes to give you the blueprint, the meeting will count as an introduction.
¬†

entry.title: Calico Egg
entry.summary:
‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 20:25, 7 June 2024
Line 6: Line 6:
¬†
|quality = false
¬†
|quality = false
¬†
}}
¬†
}}
‚àí
The '''Calico Egg''' is the currency of the [[Desert Festival]]. Several challenges and attractions offer the ability to earn Calico Eggs, which can then be used to purchase several different items from the various shops during the [[Desert Festival]]. Eggs carry over from day to day and can be saved until the last day of the festival. However, they will disappear from chests or inventory at the end of the festival and cannot be saved for the following year.
+
The '''Calico Egg''' is the currency of the [[Desert Festival]]. Several challenges and attractions offer the ability to earn Calico Eggs, which can then be used to purchase several different items from the various shops during the Desert Festival. Eggs carry over from day to day and can be saved until the last day of the festival. However, they will disappear from chests or inventory at the end of the festival and cannot be saved for the following year.
¬†¬†
¬†
Although Calico Eggs may be removed from the [[Desert Festival]], they may not be placed in an [[Incubator]] or used in "Any Egg" [[Cooking|recipes]]. Calico Eggs may not be given as [[Friendship#Gifts|gifts]] to [[villagers]].
¬†
Although Calico Eggs may be removed from the [[Desert Festival]], they may not be placed in an [[Incubator]] or used in "Any Egg" [[Cooking|recipes]]. Calico Eggs may not be given as [[Friendship#Gifts|gifts]] to [[villagers]].

The [[crafting]] recipe is unlocked at [[Fishing#Fishing Skill|Fishing level 4]]. One Worm Bin is the reward for the [[Remixed Bundles#Fish Farmer's Bundle|Fish Farmer's Bundle]], if [[Remixed Bundles]] are chosen at start of game.
+
The '''Worm Bin''' is a [[Crafting|craftable item]] that can be used to create {{name|Bait|class=inline}} for [[fishing]]. The [[crafting]] recipe is unlocked at [[Fishing#Fishing Skill|Fishing level 4]]. One Worm Bin is the reward for the {{Bundle|Fish Farmers||y}}.

entry.title: Dish O' The Sea
entry.summary:
All remixed fish bundles now give 5 dishes o' the sea as a reward.

‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 20:19, 7 June 2024
Line 14: Line 14:
¬†
'''Dish O' The Sea''' is a [[Cooking|cooked dish]]. It is prepared using either the kitchen inside an upgraded [[farmhouse]] or a [[Cookout Kit]]. It may also randomly appear in [[Krobus]]' shop on [[Days of the Week#Saturday|Saturdays]] or the [[Traveling Cart]] for {{tprice|220}}. Five Dish O' The Sea may occasionally be found in a [[Skull Cavern#Treasure Rooms|treasure room]] in the [[Skull Cavern]]. One Dish O' The Sea is a guaranteed silver tier reward on the 12th and 13th for the [[SquidFest]] festival. A Dish O' The Sea may be received from opening a [[Mystery Box]]. 2 Dishes O' The Sea may be received from opening a [[Golden Mystery Box]]. ¬†
¬†
'''Dish O' The Sea''' is a [[Cooking|cooked dish]]. It is prepared using either the kitchen inside an upgraded [[farmhouse]] or a [[Cookout Kit]]. It may also randomly appear in [[Krobus]]' shop on [[Days of the Week#Saturday|Saturdays]] or the [[Traveling Cart]] for {{tprice|220}}. Five Dish O' The Sea may occasionally be found in a [[Skull Cavern#Treasure Rooms|treasure room]] in the [[Skull Cavern]]. One Dish O' The Sea is a guaranteed silver tier reward on the 12th and 13th for the [[SquidFest]] festival. A Dish O' The Sea may be received from opening a [[Mystery Box]]. 2 Dishes O' The Sea may be received from opening a [[Golden Mystery Box]]. ¬†
¬†¬†
‚àí
The reward for completing the {{Bundle|Specialty Fish||y}} is 5 Dish O' The Sea. The reward for completing the {{Bundle|master fisher's}} or {{Bundle|quality fish||y}} is one Dish O' The Sea.
+

¬†

entry.title: Books
entry.summary:
Explain how to read a book

‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 19:46, 7 June 2024
Line 3: Line 3:
¬†¬†
¬†
'''Books''', when read, give players permanent advantages, either powers that grant abilities, knowledge, or quality-of-life upgrades like seeing sell prices, or else "points". If the player has not yet unlocked access to the [[Mastery Cave]], those "points" consist of experience points (XP) in the various game [[Skills|skills]]. Points are awarded either towards experience in one specific skill, or else are distributed equally among all skills. If the player does have access to the [[Mastery Cave]], then the "points" are [[Skills#Mastery|Mastery]] points.
¬†
'''Books''', when read, give players permanent advantages, either powers that grant abilities, knowledge, or quality-of-life upgrades like seeing sell prices, or else "points". If the player has not yet unlocked access to the [[Mastery Cave]], those "points" consist of experience points (XP) in the various game [[Skills|skills]]. Points are awarded either towards experience in one specific skill, or else are distributed equally among all skills. If the player does have access to the [[Mastery Cave]], then the "points" are [[Skills#Mastery|Mastery]] points.
¬†+
¬†+
Books must be read to receive advantages. Once found, a Book can be read by selecting it in the top row of inventory and right-clicking (as if consuming food).
¬†¬†
¬†
When playing in [[Multiplayer]], the effects from a book will only apply to the player that reads them. Individual players will need to read individual books to receive their effects.
¬†
When playing in [[Multiplayer]], the effects from a book will only apply to the player that reads them. Individual players will need to read individual books to receive their effects.

entry.title: Wizard
entry.summary:

‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 19:42, 7 June 2024
Line 12: Line 12:
¬†
The [[Wizard]], also known as '''M. Rasmodius''', is a [[Villagers|villager]] who lives in the [[Wizard's Tower]] to the far west of [[Cindersap Forest]].
¬†
The [[Wizard]], also known as '''M. Rasmodius''', is a [[Villagers|villager]] who lives in the [[Wizard's Tower]] to the far west of [[Cindersap Forest]].
¬†¬†
‚àí
Note that [[Linus]] and Wizard are visible during [[Spirit's Eve]] watching over the maze.
¬†
‚àí
¬†
¬†
==Schedule==
¬†
==Schedule==
¬†
The Wizard does not leave the [[Wizard's Tower]] (except for certain [[Festivals|Festival]] days), and can be found there when the tower is accessible (6am to 11pm).¬† After the player has unlocked the [[Witch's Hut]], he can be found in his tower after 11pm by using the warp spot in the [[Witch's Hut]]. The Wizard never visits the [[Ginger Island#Beach Resort|Beach Resort]] on Ginger Island.
¬†
The Wizard does not leave the [[Wizard's Tower]] (except for certain [[Festivals|Festival]] days), and can be found there when the tower is accessible (6am to 11pm).¬† After the player has unlocked the [[Witch's Hut]], he can be found in his tower after 11pm by using the warp spot in the [[Witch's Hut]]. The Wizard never visits the [[Ginger Island#Beach Resort|Beach Resort]] on Ginger Island.

entry.title: Krobus
entry.summary:
Trivia

‚Üê Older revision Revision as of 18:48, 7 June 2024
Line 742: Line 742:
¬†
*Krobus says that he normally does not sleep. However, he will fall asleep while watching any movie except [[Movie Theater#Movies|Mysterium]].
¬†
*Krobus says that he normally does not sleep. However, he will fall asleep while watching any movie except [[Movie Theater#Movies|Mysterium]].
¬†
*While watching Mysterium, Krobus has negative dialogue about the depiction of shadow people within the movie. However, he still likes the movie overall and gains friendship from watching it.
¬†
*While watching Mysterium, Krobus has negative dialogue about the depiction of shadow people within the movie. However, he still likes the movie overall and gains friendship from watching it.
¬†+
